centralQuestion: Should governments implement universal basic income?

reasons.description: UBI can reduce poverty by providing a stable income floor.
It may encourage entrepreneurship by reducing the risk of failure.

objections.description: UBI could disincentivize work for some recipients.
It may be too expensive to sustain without cutting other welfare programs.

expertPerspectives.name: Dr. Jane Smith
expertPerspectives.description: An economist at MIT who supports UBI based on pilot studies in Finland and Kenya.

expertPerspectives.name: Prof. Alan Jones
expertPerspectives.description: A public policy professor skeptical of UBI’s long-term fiscal viability.

research.title: UBI Pilot Programs: What We’ve Learned
research.description: An in-depth analysis of several international UBI trials and their effects on labor, health, and education.

research.title: Funding UBI: Economic Models Compared
research.description: Compares various economic models to evaluate the sustainability of different UBI proposals.
